entry.title: NIKKOR-O Auto 1:2 f=35mm
entry.summary: Portrait of a lens I've kept since I was a teenager.

div.p: This is a portrait of a lens I've kept since I was a teenager. You can see it in an earlier entry. There are quite a few web sites from Nikon F aficionados, such as Richard de Stoutz' Nikon F Collection & Typology who owns an almost complete series of the lens and experienced professional users such as Bjørn Rørslett. who owns some 100 lenses and give ratings a lot of lenses including Nikon F wide angle ones.
Bjørn gives this lens rating 5 for use with film based cameras and 4 otherwise (digital photography). 5 is the highest score on his list, and it implies:

p.em: Excellent. Use such lenses as often as possible and let other people wonder about the quality you can achieve with them.

div.p: I leave it to Bjørn and others to achieve quality people will wonder about. A lens is an artist's tool, and the quality of the result depends on his or her skills. Be that as it may; a survey on eBay shows that you can get one of them for between $20 and $100, depending on whether the previous owner has used it as often as possible or not.
